sense.name: expire; cease living or existing
sense.commentary: Includes: DIE OUT, DIE BACK, DIE OFF Note: May be [transitive]--see example 4 Requires a physical entity that is dying, non-physical entities are ocvered by sense 9.
sense.examples: The children died in the fire. She died of cancer. Martyrs die every day for their faith. He died a gruesome death. Whosoever believes in me shall never die!

sense.name: lessen in intensity
sense.commentary: Includes: DIE DOWN Note: The entity lessens, but this sense does not entail that the entity disappears, it can only be inferred that it exists in a lesser amount.
sense.examples: The laughter died down. The furor has died down, but the Dixie Chicks haven't.

sense.name: to desire, long for something
sense.examples: She was dying for a cigarette. I was dying to leave.

sense.name: stop operating or functioning
sense.examples: Should have expected problems when the coffee maker died this morning. One week later, the car died and wouldn't restart.

sense.name: pall, become flat (of alcohol)
sense.examples: It is a shame to devote years of effort to cellaring only to have your wine die in the bottle.

sense.name: cut or shape with a die
sense.examples: Die out leather for the belts.

sense.name: be on base at the end of an inning
continue to exist; idiomatic expression
sense.examples: These stories die hard. Old habits die hard.

sense.name: disappearance, cessation of a non-physical entity
sense.commentary: Includes: DIE OUT, DIE BACK, DIE OFF, DIE AWAY Note: May be used metaphorically--ceasing to exist relative to a context.
sense.examples: My secret will die with me. The words died on his lips. Her desire died when she caught him picking his nose. The storm died away. The murmur of whispered conversations slowly died away as the jury trudged back in. The musician's voilin died away like a voice fading away in the distance. Slowly, the laughter died off.

sense.name: to experience intense emotion
sense.examples: She almost died of embarrassment when her skirt split. We died laughing during the show.

sense.name: feel indifferent towards
sense.examples: You're dead to me. She died to wordly things and entered a monastery.
